thread.title: Kelechi Iheanacho: City manager, Guardiola reveals why he didn’t play striker against Huddersfield Town
thread.title_full: Kelechi Iheanacho: City manager, Guardiola reveals why he didn’t play striker against Huddersfield Town

author: Steve Dede
title: Kelechi Iheanacho: City manager, Guardiola reveals why he didn’t play striker against Huddersfield Town
text: Tweet Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has revealed why he didn’t use Kelechi Iheanacho in their goalless draw at Huddersfield Town on Saturday, February 18. Iheancho who has not been named in a Manchester City matchday squad for five consecutive games was on the bench in City fifth round FA Cup clash at Huddersfield Town which ended in a goalless draw. With time running out and no goal scored, Guardiola did not call on Iheanacho and he explained why after the game. ” We have only one striker (Iheanacho) on the bench, but we wanted to bring in creativity in the midfield and also inject pace on the wings, that was why we didn’t introduce a striker for a striker ,” the manager said. play Pep Guardiola says he didn't call on Iheanacho because he wanted creativity from the midfield and wings (Getty Images) ” Huddersfield Town were very organised at the back and kudo s to them for keeping the scores at 0-0, we go again in few days time in what will be an interesting tie ”. Iheanacho will hope to get some game time when City host Monaco in the first leg of their second round Champions League tie on Tuesday, February 21. Tweet Author
